description: Alterations to the ground floor rear elevation involving the installation a six folding door and the insertion of a door in lieu of the window; enlargement of a side window; insertion of a rooflight to the ground floor rear extension; installation of one roof lights to side roof slope; change the fence to palisade fence on front elevation; internal alterations to all floors with the general refurbishment of the house (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled: A717/L1 LOCATION PLAN, A717/PM01 Existing Ground Floor and Garden Plan, A717/PM02 Existing First Floor, Second Floor and Loft Plans, A717/PM03 Existing Front and Side Street Elevations, A717/PM04 Existing Rear and Side Elevations, A717/PL01 REV.A Proposed Ground Floor and Garden Plan, A717/PL03 REV.A Proposed Front and Side Street Elevations, A717/PL04 Proposed Rear and Side Elevations, A717/PL20 Joinery Details with Double Glazing, A717/PL21 Velux Conservation Rooflight Details, A717/PL22 Palisade Fence and Pedestrian Gate Details,  HERITAGE STATEMENT AND DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT, A717/PL02 Rev.A Proposed First Floor, Second Floor and Loft Plans (received on 26/10/2022)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The roof lights shall be 'conservation style', installed to be flush with the existing roof slope, and permanently retained.

REASON: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Bedford Park Conservation Area Management Plan. | No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years within the front garden, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of preserving and enhancing the character of the Conservation Area and the Listed building, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies D3, D4, D8, HC1, G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021.
